verses.verse: The sin<WH2403> of Judah<WH3063> is written<WH3789> with a pen<WH5842> of iron<WH1270>, and with the point<WH6856> of a diamond<WH8068>: it is graven<WH2790> upon the table<WH3871> of their heart<WH3820>, and upon the horns<WH7161> of your altars<WH4196>;

¶ Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>; Cursed<WH779> be the man<WH1397> that trusteth<WH982> in man<WH120>, and maketh<WH7760> flesh<WH1320> his arm<WH2220>, and whose heart<WH3820> departeth<WH5493> from the LORD<WH3068>.

For he shall be like the heath<WH6199> in the desert<WH6160>, and shall not see<WH7200> when good<WH2896> cometh<WH935>; but shall inhabit<WH7931> the parched places<WH2788> in the wilderness<WH4057>, in a salt<WH4420> land<WH776> and not inhabited<WH3427>.
Blessed<WH1288> is the man<WH1397> that trusteth<WH982> in the LORD<WH3068>, and whose hope<WH4009> the LORD<WH3068> is.

For he shall be as a tree<WH6086> planted<WH8362> by the waters<WH4325>, and that spreadeth out<WH7971> her roots<WH8328> by the river<WH3105>, and shall not see<WH7200> when heat<WH2527> cometh<WH935>, but her leaf<WH5929> shall be green<WH7488>; and shall not be careful<WH1672> in the year<WH8141> of drought<WH1226>, neither shall cease<WH4185> from yielding<WH6213> fruit<WH6529>.
¶ The heart<WH3820> is deceitful<WH6121> above all things, and desperately wicked<WH605>: who can know<WH3045> it?

I the LORD<WH3068> search<WH2713> the heart<WH3820>, I try<WH974> the reins<WH3629>, even to give<WH5414> every man<WH376> according to his ways<WH1870>, and according to the fruit<WH6529> of his doings<WH4611>.

¶ A glorious<WH3519> high<WH4791> throne<WH3678> from the beginning<WH7223> is the place<WH4725> of our sanctuary<WH4720>.

O LORD<WH3068>, the hope<WH4723> of Israel<WH3478>, all that forsake<WH5800> thee shall be ashamed<WH954>, and they that depart<WH3249> from me<WH5493> shall be written<WH3789> in the earth<WH776>, because they have forsaken<WH5800> the LORD<WH3068>, the fountain<WH4726> of living<WH2416> waters<WH4325>.
Heal<WH7495> me, O LORD<WH3068>, and I shall be healed<WH7495>; save<WH3467> me, and I shall be saved<WH3467>: for thou art my praise<WH8416>.
¶ Behold, they say<WH559> unto me, Where is the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068>? let it come<WH935> now.

As for me, I have not hastened<WH213> from being a pastor<WH7462> to follow<WH310> thee: neither have I desired<WH183> the woeful<WH605> day<WH3117>; thou knowest<WH3045>: that which came out<WH4161> of my lips<WH8193> was right before<WH5227> thee<WH6440>.
Be not a terror<WH4288> unto me: thou art my hope<WH4268> in the day<WH3117> of evil<WH7451>.

Let them be confounded<WH954> that persecute<WH7291> me, but let not me be confounded<WH954>: let them be dismayed<WH2865>, but let not me be dismayed<WH2865>: bring<WH935> upon them the day<WH3117> of evil<WH7451>, and destroy<WH7665> them with double<WH4932> destruction<WH7670>.

¶ Thus said<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> unto me; Go<WH1980> and stand<WH5975> in the gate<WH8179> of the children<WH1121> of the people<WH5971>, whereby the kings<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> come in<WH935>, and by the which they go out<WH3318>, and in all the gates<WH8179> of Jerusalem<WH3389>;

And say<WH559> unto them, Hear<WH8085> ye the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068>, ye kings<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>, and all Judah<WH3063>, and all the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, that enter in<WH935> by these gates<WH8179>:

Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>; Take heed<WH8104> to yourselves<WH5315>, and bear<WH5375> no burden<WH4853> on the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>, nor bring<WH935> it in by the gates<WH8179> of Jerusalem<WH3389>;

But they obeyed<WH8085> not, neither inclined<WH5186> their ear<WH241>, but made their neck<WH6203> stiff<WH7185>, that they might not hear<WH8085>, nor receive<WH3947> instruction<WH4148>.

And it shall come to pass, if ye diligently<WH8085> hearken<WH8085> unto me, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>, to bring<WH935> in no burden<WH4853> through the gates<WH8179> of this city<WH5892> on the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>, but hallow<WH6942> the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>, to do<WH6213> no<WH1115> work<WH4399> therein;

Then shall there enter<WH935> into the gates<WH8179> of this city<WH5892> kings<WH4428> and princes<WH8269> sitting<WH3427> upon the throne<WH3678> of David<WH1732>, riding<WH7392> in chariots<WH7393> and on horses<WH5483>, they, and their princes<WH8269>, the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063>, and the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem<WH3389>: and this city<WH5892> shall remain<WH3427> for ever<WH5769>.

And they shall come<WH935> from the cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063>, and from the places about<WH5439> Jerusalem<WH3389>, and from the land<WH776> of Benjamin<WH1144>, and from the plain<WH8219>, and from the mountains<WH2022>, and from the south<WH5045>, bringing<WH935> burnt offerings<WH5930>, and sacrifices<WH2077>, and meat offerings<WH4503>, and incense<WH3828>, and bringing<WH935> sacrifices of praise<WH8426>, unto the house<WH1004> of the LORD<WH3068>.

But if ye will not hearken<WH8085> unto me to hallow<WH6942> the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>, and not to bear<WH5375> a burden<WH4853>, even entering in<WH935> at the gates<WH8179> of Jerusalem<WH3389> on the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>; then will I kindle<WH3341> a fire<WH784> in the gates<WH8179> thereof, and it shall devour<WH398> the palaces<WH759> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, and it shall not be quenched<WH3518>.
